Dead by daylight is enjoyable whether you want to be a survivor and try fix generators and escape from the killer or be the killer and kill the survivors i usually hop on and have a fun game i recommend it even more if a friend has it

Personaly I only hate this game for the awful matchmaking sistem. My last few games have been and I citate: Iredescent I, Iredescent IV, Gold I, Ash II (game 1). Game 2:Silver II, Gold I, Iredescent III and Iredescent I. May I remind you that my rank is Bronze II? Another thing, I wish this game could understand the fact that Myers needs a buff to gained bloodpoints, because for the last 2 weeks I have been trying to get Adept Shape but either I was matchmaked by players WAY above my level either players with a rank SUBSTANTIAL LOWER than mine. Now, RPD, I personally hate this map, both for killer and survivor reasons :too big, confusing layout and overall not a good map, Aka I'd rather DC. Badham preschool, as a killer, this map is just as bad as RPD but here there are a lot of good loops and some God palets/houses.
     Edit: Really devs, fix your matchmaking sistem, I have returned to this game after a few months,got matched with a full rank 1 team, mind i tell you I am ash 4, what is the most interesting part is, that this shit only happens when I play survivor.Conclusion
1. FIX YOUR FUCKING GAME, DO NOT FOCUS ON A GODDAM DATING SIM FOR LOSERS
2.Do not add so many DLCs, the number of killers there is now is ok, even like this, sometimes feels like playing russian roulette with killers, take it from me, 230 hours, seen the twins 3 times total.
3. Nerf and buff the perks are to op/useless
4. (ties with 1) fix the hitboxes(really, it is fucking awful)
5.Show the community you care about them, add more events, blood rushes, shit like this
 Look, I do not know in what situation you are in as a company but caring about your game brings more players back, fixing the game in all the perviously stated arguments will make the game more likeable, interesting both new, and old players in this game, have a nice day

Sure there's a share of bad review and questionable opinion about the devs' decision (you can read up more on that), but sheer amount of still active players even after the game was launched years ago and the hours they clock in (even on the one giving bad review) tells the otherwise.
Not a bad game if you are ready to suffer for the first 100 hours.

I was depressed... I felt empty... nothing was important to me... Then I found the light, Dead by daylight opened my eyes to a whole new level. I felt the rush of killing each and every survivor with my bare hands. I loved it, and i wanted more of it. Dead by Daylight brings joy in ways that cannot be expressed. 

Warning! this game is very addictive.

This game is terrible would rate 0/10, every time they come out with a new killer/ Character its even more broken then the last one.  The developer's do not even care enough to try and balance the game. The events they put on for Halloween were super lame. I don't even know why i still play this trash game.

The premise of the game is simple: Four survivors work together to try to repair 5 generators so they can open a door and escape a map. They are opposed by a Killer who wants to kill all of the survivors by putting them on hooks for an invisible Entity to take them for eternity. Both the survivors and the killer can bring perks, items, add-ons, and offerings that can influence things in the game.

It sounds fun, and at times it can be. The problem: the grind is excessive, the game loop gets boring, and toxic behavior runs rampant in the game. Killers camp, survivors bully, and there is no way to check that behavior at all. It makes the game boring when you are a survivor and you get downed, hooked, camped, and tunneled within the first 2 minutes of the match. Then you switch to killer to let off some steam, get matched with survivors who are waaaaay above your rank who just taunt you, loop you, and blind you with 4 flashlights constantly. Then you just lose any desire to play the game and leave.

The game also has the "Season Pass" to get special cosmetics that prey on people who suffer from FOMO. Tie that with the devs breaking the game every new chapter and not fixing most of the bugs that are found in the game because they are cosmetic-focused, and you get an experience that is just below average. Playing with friends can make it a tolerable experience, but it still just ends up being something that you can forget.

Once purchased, the game can be very rough for both survivor and killer, majority of games you will prob lose and not have a clue whats going on or what your goal is. Once you get a few hundred hours into the game and get a general knowledge of the game it can be very fun. It's always been my game to play just to kill time when I can't think of anything else to do.
If you like getting touched by 40 year olds go ahead 10/10 in my opinion!
